intro: Macroscepis cornejoi, commonly known as the Corsican heath. It is a flowering plant native to the island of Corsica, characterized by its dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
